poem:
### Ceaseless Chess

In Kyiv's shadow,  
leaders stand, their words  
like stones in a river  
of diplomacy's flow—  
a game with no squares,  
only echoes of power:  
offers, threats—  
air spun with silence,  
resonant in Europe's chest.  
The world watches,  
breath bated, for a hand  
to still the pieces,  
yet the board remains.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Week of geopolitical poker over Ukraine ends with no endgame in sight This week began with four European leaders, standing defiantly in Kyiv alongside Volodymyr Zelenskyy, issuing an ultimatum to Vladimir Putin: sign a ceasefire now, or together with Donald Trump we will force you to do so, with sanctions and other tough measures. Over the subsequent days, there followed a series of offers, counter-offers, ultimatums and deflections, in a dizzying week of high-stakes diplomacy". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
